content.raw:
That's the perfect result. By default, every object should collide with every object.

However, imagine I have a floor collision object. An elevator must pass through this floor. At the same time, default objects (robots, spheres, etc) must collide with both the elevator and the floor. Given these constraints, and the default bitmask of 0x01, I challenge you to come up with two more bitmasks (one for the elevator and one for the floor) that have the correct results.

Hint: It's impossible unless the default bitmask is widened, to something like 0xffff.
